DOC.brief_summary: Study will test the use of narratives on patient satisfaction and translation of an evidence-based approach to the use of X-rays for leg injuries in the Emergency Department (ED). The investigators will identify patients with foot, ankle, or knee injuries for whom X-rays are determined to not be needed. On discharge, patients will receive the current fact-based sheet or that plus a narrative explaining the work-up and treatment of these injuries. Outcomes will be assessed by a survey measuring patient satisfaction and understanding.
DOC.brief_title: Stories to Educate Patients With Ankle, Foot, and Knee Injuries
DOC.criteria: Acute traumatic knee, ankle or foot injury presenting to ED No indication for Xray by Ottawa Rules criteria ED provider planning to discharge patient Xray obtained Need for Xray by established Ottawa Rules criteria Children Pregnant women Patient to be admitted to the hospital Patient nonEnglish speaking or illiterate
